resources.string: In addition, you will discuss the outcome of the trial(s) during future meeting.
This form for the trial has been saved.
You will now need to implement new AT solutions.
After completing the trial(s), please reopen this file and select "Trial" on the home page to finish the remaining part of the form.
In addition, you will discuss the outcome of the trial(s) during future meeting.
This form for the second trial has been saved.
You will now need to implement new AT solutions.
After completing the trial(s), please reopen this file and select "2nd Trial" on the home page to finish the remaining part of the form.
In addition, you will discuss the outcome of the trial(s) during future meeting.
Complete the following form(s) for each area identified.
Does the student benefit from accessible versions of printed educational material?
Does the student benefit from alternate reading supports(e.g., read aloud, text-to-speech, large print, braille, accessible text)?
Briefly list currently being used strategies, accommodations, assistive technology on general education, special education, community, work and home settings.
Since you selected \"Yes\" to these questions, do you want to determine the student\'s eligibility for AIM-VA services.

There have been changes in the student\'s functional or academic performance, or current strategies are NOT adequate and could require new assistive technology or a change in current AT (devices or services) provided.

There have been changes in the student\'s functional or academic performance, or current strategies are NOT adequate and could require new assistive technology or a change in current AT (devices or services) provided.
Current strategies are adequate and documented in student\'s IEP.

string-array.name: readSolutions
string-array.item: Page fluffers (e.g. foam paper clipped to pages to separate them)
Slant boards and book holders for positioning books
Tracking strategies (e.g reading window, bar magnifier)
Speaking spell checker or dictionary as a word recognition aid (e.g. Franklin Talking Dictionary)
Reading Pen (e.g. Personal Reading Assistant, Quicktionary II)
Audio-taped books (e.g. books-on-tape from Recordings for the Blind and Dyslexic, commercial audio books)
Portable reading system for digital audio books (e.g. ClassMate)
Computer with graphic-based word processor (e.g. Writing with Symbols, Pix Writer)
Computer with talking word processing software (e.g. Write:Outloud, IntelliTalk)
Computer with word prediction software (e.g. Co:Writer, WordQ)
Scanner and computer with form filling software to create electronic worksheets
Computer with graphic word processor (e.g. Writing with Symbols, Pix Writer)
Computer with text enlargement software (e.g. ZoomText)
Computer with text reading software (e.g. Read:OutLoud, ReadPlease, Talk-to-Me)
Computer-based advanced reading aids (e.g. Kerzweil 3000, WYNN)
Solutions for converting text into alternative format (e.g. scanner with OCR software, Braille translation software, Braille printer)

string-array.name: writeSolutions
string-array.item: Pencil grip or other adapted writing aids
Adapted paper (e.g. bold line, raised line. different spacing, secured to desk, paper stabilizers)
Tape recorder for dictated responses and note taking
Notetaking device (e.g. Braille, adapted tape recorder, Smartboard, Notetaker)
Computer with word processing software with spell and grammar checks (e.g. Microsoft Word)
Computer with word processing software and outlining/webbing software (e.g. Inspiration, Kidspiration, DraftBuilder)
Computer with graphic-based word processor (e.g. Writing with Symbols, Pix Writer)
Computer with talking word processing software (e.g. Write:OutLoud, IntelliTalk)
Computer with word prediction software (e.g. Co:Writer, WordQ)
Scanner and computer with form filling software to create electronic worksheets

string-array.name: spellingSolutions
string-array.item: Personal dry erase board for practice
Tape recorder with difficult to spell words recorded
Hand-held spellchecker without auditory output (e.g. Franklin)
Hand-held spellchecker with auditory output (e.g. Franklin Talking Dictionary)
Portable word processor with built-in spellchecker (e.g. Neo, The Writer)
Computer with word processing software with spell check feature (e.g. Microsoft Word)
Computer with talking word processing software containing speaking spell check (e.g. Write:OutLoud)
Computer with word prediction software, (e.g. Co:Writer, WordQ)

string-array.name: mathSolutions
string-array.item: Modified paper (e.g. bold line, enlarged, raised line, graph paper etc.)
Electronic math worksheet software with adaptive input and output as needed (e.g. MathPad, MathPad by Voice, Study)
Graphing calculator software (e.g. Accessible Graphing Calculator)
Adapted measuring devices (e.g. devices with speech output, large print display, or tactile output)

string-array.name: listeningSolutions
string-array.item: Smart Board for transferring teacher written notes to student computer for viewing or printing and reviewing
Voice to text software application for converting teacher lecture to text
Closed captioning on non-caption ready instructional materials
Real time captioning of class lecture and discussion

resources.string: Describe new AT or services to be tried or modified.
Enter service here or click "+" button to look up the idea bank.
Please select at least one instructional area.
The form is not completed, please fill all the information
Student Id must contain 3-9 letters or numbers with a maximum of 2 letters.
Student Id Format: 3-9 letters or numbers, at most 2 letters
All, if any, information related to this deleted task will not apprear on the following screens and will be erased
Do you want to save this information before going to the home page?
Cannot save this student information because studentId is not in correct format.
Please fill every AT service before adding new AT service.
Since some of your trials were not successful make referral to your school division for Assistive Technology Assesment. For additional information, go to link below:
Click on the process (rectangle shape) or decision (diamond shape) to know more about it.
Great, student is eligible for AIM-VA materials. \nVisit https://aimva.org/ for more information.

All, if any, informatin (Tasks/ATs etc) related to this deselected area will not apppear on all following screens and will be ERASED if you SAVE this student record afterwards or when you touch NEXT button.
There are two requirements that must be met to assure a student is eligible for AIM-VA materials:

1. The student has an Individualized Education Program (IEP) that indicates the student MAY benefit from using alternative print materials for reading. 
 2. The student has a print disability due to one of the following:
*Low Vision/Blindness
*Physical Disabilities
*Other Disabilities
Sorry, student is not eligible for AIM-VA materials.\nVisit https://aimva.org/ for more information
Great, student is eligible for AIM-VA materials.\nVisit https://aimva.org/ for more information

All users must adhere to the local school division/agency policies and procedures to ensure the protection of confidentiality of personally identifiable information of students\' scholastic records during the collection, storage, disclosure and destruction of informaion.
Sorry! You must agree to the confidentiality agreement.

You have indicated no instructional areas identified. If this is correct, press "OK", which will end this form and ERASE all the information entered after this page if YES was chosen before. Otherwise select "Cancel".
Identify instructional area that is difficult for the student
